    Register ( slcr )PCFGQOS0_1

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCFGQOS0_1 0XFD070544 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_1_RQOS_MAP_REGION2 25:24 3000000 2 2000000 This bitfield indicates the traffic class of region2. For dual address queue configurations, region2 maps to the red address queue. Valid values are 1: VPR and 2: HPR only. When VPR support is disabled (UMCTL2_VPR_EN = 0) and traffic class of region2 is set to 1 (VPR), VPR traffic is aliased to LPR traffic.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_1_RQOS_MAP_REGION1 21:20 300000 0 0 This bitfield indicates the traffic class of region 1. Valid values are: 0 : LPR, 1: VPR, 2: HPR. For dual address queue configurations, region1 maps to the blue address queue. In this case, valid values are 0: LPR and 1: VPR only. When VPR support is disabled (UMCTL2_VPR_EN = 0) and traffic class of region 1 is set to 1 (VPR), VPR traffic is aliased to LPR traffic.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_1_RQOS_MAP_REGION0 17:16 30000 0 0 This bitfield indicates the traffic class of region 0. Valid values are: 0: LPR, 1: VPR, 2: HPR. For dual address queue configurations, region 0 maps to the blue address queue. In this case, valid values are: 0: LPR and 1: VPR only. When VPR support is disabled (UMCTL2_VPR_EN = 0) and traffic class of region0 is set to 1 (VPR), VPR traffic is aliased to LPR traffic.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_1_RQOS_MAP_LEVEL2 11:8 f00 b b00 Separation level2 indicating the end of region1 mapping; start of region1 is (level1 + 1). Possible values for level2 are (level1 + 1) to 14 which corresponds to arqos. Region2 starts from (level2 + 1) up to 15. Note that for PA, arqos values are used directly as port priorities, where the higher the value corresponds to higher port priority. All of the map_level* registers must be set to distinct values.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_1_RQOS_MAP_LEVEL1 3:0 f 3 3 Separation level1 indicating the end of region0 mapping; start of region0 is 0. Possible values for level1 are 0 to 13 (for dual RAQ) or 0 to 14 (for single RAQ) which corresponds to arqos. Note that for PA, arqos values are used directly as port priorities, where the higher the value corresponds to higher port priority. All of the map_level* registers must be set to distinct values.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_1@0XFD070544 31:0 3330f0f 2000b03 Port n Read QoS Configuration Register 0

    Register ( slcr )PCFGQOS1_1

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCFGQOS1_1 0XFD070548 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS1_1_RQOS_MAP_TIMEOUTR 26:16 7ff0000 0 0 Specifies the timeout value for transactions mapped to the red address queue.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS1_1_RQOS_MAP_TIMEOUTB 10:0 7ff 0 0 Specifies the timeout value for transactions mapped to the blue address queue.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS1_1@0XFD070548 31:0 7ff07ff 0 Port n Read QoS Configuration Register 1

    Register ( slcr )PCFGR_2

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCFGR_2 0XFD070564 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGR_2_RD_PORT_PAGEMATCH_EN 14:14 4000 0 0 If set to 1, enables the Page Match feature. If enabled, once a requesting port is granted, the port is continued to be granted if the following immediate commands are to the same memory page (same bank and same row). See also related PCCFG.pagematch_limit register.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGR_2_RD_PORT_URGENT_EN 13:13 2000 1 2000 If set to 1, enables the AXI urgent sideband signal (arurgent). When enabled and arurgent is asserted by the master, that port becomes the highest priority and co_gs_go2critical_lpr/co_gs_go2critical_hpr signal to DDRC is asserted if enabled in PCCFG.go2critical_en register. Note that arurgent signal can be asserted anytime and as long as required which is independent of address handshaking (it is not associated with any particular command).
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGR_2_RD_PORT_AGING_EN 12:12 1000 0 0 If set to 1, enables aging function for the read channel of the port.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGR_2_RD_PORT_PRIORITY 9:0 3ff f f Determines the initial load value of read aging counters. These counters will be parallel loaded after reset, or after each grant to the corresponding port. The aging counters down-count every clock cycle where the port is requesting but not granted. The higher significant 5-bits of the read aging counter sets the priority of the read channel of a given port. Port's priority will increase as the higher significant 5-bits of the counter starts to decrease. When the aging counter becomes 0, the corresponding port channel will have the highest priority level (timeout condition - Priority0). For multi-port configurations, the aging counters cannot be used to set port priorities when external dynamic priority inputs (arqos) are enabled (timeout is still applicable). For single port configurations, the aging counters are only used when they timeout (become 0) to force read-write direction switching. In this case, external dynamic priority input, arqos (for reads only) can still be used to set the DDRC read priority (2 priority levels: low priority read - LPR, high priority read - HPR) on a command by command basis. Note: The two LSBs of this register field are tied internally to 2'b00.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGR_2@0XFD070564 31:0 73ff 200f Port n Configuration Read Register

    Register ( slcr )PCFGW_2

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCFGW_2 0XFD070568 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGW_2_WR_PORT_PAGEMATCH_EN 14:14 4000 1 4000 If set to 1, enables the Page Match feature. If enabled, once a requesting port is granted, the port is continued to be granted if the following immediate commands are to the same memory page (same bank and same row). See also related PCCFG.pagematch_limit register.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGW_2_WR_PORT_URGENT_EN 13:13 2000 1 2000 If set to 1, enables the AXI urgent sideband signal (awurgent). When enabled and awurgent is asserted by the master, that port becomes the highest priority and co_gs_go2critical_wr signal to DDRC is asserted if enabled in PCCFG.go2critical_en register. Note that awurgent signal can be asserted anytime and as long as required which is independent of address handshaking (it is not associated with any particular command).
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGW_2_WR_PORT_AGING_EN 12:12 1000 0 0 If set to 1, enables aging function for the write channel of the port.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGW_2_WR_PORT_PRIORITY 9:0 3ff f f Determines the initial load value of write aging counters. These counters will be parallel loaded after reset, or after each grant to the corresponding port. The aging counters down-count every clock cycle where the port is requesting but not granted. The higher significant 5-bits of the write aging counter sets the initial priority of the write channel of a given port. Port's priority will increase as the higher significant 5-bits of the counter starts to decrease. When the aging counter becomes 0, the corresponding port channel will have the highest priority level. For multi-port configurations, the aging counters cannot be used to set port priorities when external dynamic priority inputs (awqos) are enabled (timeout is still applicable). For single port configurations, the aging counters are only used when they timeout (become 0) to force read-write direction switching. Note: The two LSBs of this register field are tied internally to 2'b00.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGW_2@0XFD070568 31:0 73ff 600f Port n Configuration Write Register

    Register ( slcr )PCTRL_2

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCTRL_2 0XFD0705F0 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCTRL_2_PORT_EN 0:0 1 1 1 Enables port n.
    PSU_DDRC_PCTRL_2@0XFD0705F0 31:0 1 1 Port n Control Register

    Register ( slcr )PCFGQOS0_2

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCFGQOS0_2 0XFD0705F4 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_2_RQOS_MAP_REGION2 25:24 3000000 2 2000000 This bitfield indicates the traffic class of region2. For dual address queue configurations, region2 maps to the red address queue. Valid values are 1: VPR and 2: HPR only. When VPR support is disabled (UMCTL2_VPR_EN = 0) and traffic class of region2 is set to 1 (VPR), VPR traffic is aliased to LPR traffic.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_2_RQOS_MAP_REGION1 21:20 300000 0 0 This bitfield indicates the traffic class of region 1. Valid values are: 0 : LPR, 1: VPR, 2: HPR. For dual address queue configurations, region1 maps to the blue address queue. In this case, valid values are 0: LPR and 1: VPR only. When VPR support is disabled (UMCTL2_VPR_EN = 0) and traffic class of region 1 is set to 1 (VPR), VPR traffic is aliased to LPR traffic.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_2_RQOS_MAP_REGION0 17:16 30000 0 0 This bitfield indicates the traffic class of region 0. Valid values are: 0: LPR, 1: VPR, 2: HPR. For dual address queue configurations, region 0 maps to the blue address queue. In this case, valid values are: 0: LPR and 1: VPR only. When VPR support is disabled (UMCTL2_VPR_EN = 0) and traffic class of region0 is set to 1 (VPR), VPR traffic is aliased to LPR traffic.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_2_RQOS_MAP_LEVEL2 11:8 f00 b b00 Separation level2 indicating the end of region1 mapping; start of region1 is (level1 + 1). Possible values for level2 are (level1 + 1) to 14 which corresponds to arqos. Region2 starts from (level2 + 1) up to 15. Note that for PA, arqos values are used directly as port priorities, where the higher the value corresponds to higher port priority. All of the map_level* registers must be set to distinct values.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_2_RQOS_MAP_LEVEL1 3:0 f 3 3 Separation level1 indicating the end of region0 mapping; start of region0 is 0. Possible values for level1 are 0 to 13 (for dual RAQ) or 0 to 14 (for single RAQ) which corresponds to arqos. Note that for PA, arqos values are used directly as port priorities, where the higher the value corresponds to higher port priority. All of the map_level* registers must be set to distinct values.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_2@0XFD0705F4 31:0 3330f0f 2000b03 Port n Read QoS Configuration Register 0

    Register ( slcr )PCFGQOS1_2

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCFGQOS1_2 0XFD0705F8 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS1_2_RQOS_MAP_TIMEOUTR 26:16 7ff0000 0 0 Specifies the timeout value for transactions mapped to the red address queue.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS1_2_RQOS_MAP_TIMEOUTB 10:0 7ff 0 0 Specifies the timeout value for transactions mapped to the blue address queue.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS1_2@0XFD0705F8 31:0 7ff07ff 0 Port n Read QoS Configuration Register 1

    Register ( slcr )PCFGR_3

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCFGR_3 0XFD070614 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGR_3_RD_PORT_PAGEMATCH_EN 14:14 4000 0 0 If set to 1, enables the Page Match feature. If enabled, once a requesting port is granted, the port is continued to be granted if the following immediate commands are to the same memory page (same bank and same row). See also related PCCFG.pagematch_limit register.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGR_3_RD_PORT_URGENT_EN 13:13 2000 1 2000 If set to 1, enables the AXI urgent sideband signal (arurgent). When enabled and arurgent is asserted by the master, that port becomes the highest priority and co_gs_go2critical_lpr/co_gs_go2critical_hpr signal to DDRC is asserted if enabled in PCCFG.go2critical_en register. Note that arurgent signal can be asserted anytime and as long as required which is independent of address handshaking (it is not associated with any particular command).
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGR_3_RD_PORT_AGING_EN 12:12 1000 0 0 If set to 1, enables aging function for the read channel of the port.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGR_3_RD_PORT_PRIORITY 9:0 3ff f f Determines the initial load value of read aging counters. These counters will be parallel loaded after reset, or after each grant to the corresponding port. The aging counters down-count every clock cycle where the port is requesting but not granted. The higher significant 5-bits of the read aging counter sets the priority of the read channel of a given port. Port's priority will increase as the higher significant 5-bits of the counter starts to decrease. When the aging counter becomes 0, the corresponding port channel will have the highest priority level (timeout condition - Priority0). For multi-port configurations, the aging counters cannot be used to set port priorities when external dynamic priority inputs (arqos) are enabled (timeout is still applicable). For single port configurations, the aging counters are only used when they timeout (become 0) to force read-write direction switching. In this case, external dynamic priority input, arqos (for reads only) can still be used to set the DDRC read priority (2 priority levels: low priority read - LPR, high priority read - HPR) on a command by command basis. Note: The two LSBs of this register field are tied internally to 2'b00.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGR_3@0XFD070614 31:0 73ff 200f Port n Configuration Read Register

    Register ( slcr )PCFGW_3

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCFGW_3 0XFD070618 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGW_3_WR_PORT_PAGEMATCH_EN 14:14 4000 1 4000 If set to 1, enables the Page Match feature. If enabled, once a requesting port is granted, the port is continued to be granted if the following immediate commands are to the same memory page (same bank and same row). See also related PCCFG.pagematch_limit register.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGW_3_WR_PORT_URGENT_EN 13:13 2000 1 2000 If set to 1, enables the AXI urgent sideband signal (awurgent). When enabled and awurgent is asserted by the master, that port becomes the highest priority and co_gs_go2critical_wr signal to DDRC is asserted if enabled in PCCFG.go2critical_en register. Note that awurgent signal can be asserted anytime and as long as required which is independent of address handshaking (it is not associated with any particular command).
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGW_3_WR_PORT_AGING_EN 12:12 1000 0 0 If set to 1, enables aging function for the write channel of the port.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGW_3_WR_PORT_PRIORITY 9:0 3ff f f Determines the initial load value of write aging counters. These counters will be parallel loaded after reset, or after each grant to the corresponding port. The aging counters down-count every clock cycle where the port is requesting but not granted. The higher significant 5-bits of the write aging counter sets the initial priority of the write channel of a given port. Port's priority will increase as the higher significant 5-bits of the counter starts to decrease. When the aging counter becomes 0, the corresponding port channel will have the highest priority level. For multi-port configurations, the aging counters cannot be used to set port priorities when external dynamic priority inputs (awqos) are enabled (timeout is still applicable). For single port configurations, the aging counters are only used when they timeout (become 0) to force read-write direction switching. Note: The two LSBs of this register field are tied internally to 2'b00.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGW_3@0XFD070618 31:0 73ff 600f Port n Configuration Write Register

    Register ( slcr )PCTRL_3

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCTRL_3 0XFD0706A0 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCTRL_3_PORT_EN 0:0 1 1 1 Enables port n.
    PSU_DDRC_PCTRL_3@0XFD0706A0 31:0 1 1 Port n Control Register

    Register ( slcr )PCFGQOS0_3

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCFGQOS0_3 0XFD0706A4 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_3_RQOS_MAP_REGION1 21:20 300000 1 100000 This bitfield indicates the traffic class of region 1. Valid values are: 0 : LPR, 1: VPR, 2: HPR. For dual address queue configurations, region1 maps to the blue address queue. In this case, valid values are 0: LPR and 1: VPR only. When VPR support is disabled (UMCTL2_VPR_EN = 0) and traffic class of region 1 is set to 1 (VPR), VPR traffic is aliased to LPR traffic.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_3_RQOS_MAP_REGION0 17:16 30000 0 0 This bitfield indicates the traffic class of region 0. Valid values are: 0: LPR, 1: VPR, 2: HPR. For dual address queue configurations, region 0 maps to the blue address queue. In this case, valid values are: 0: LPR and 1: VPR only. When VPR support is disabled (UMCTL2_VPR_EN = 0) and traffic class of region0 is set to 1 (VPR), VPR traffic is aliased to LPR traffic.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_3_RQOS_MAP_LEVEL1 3:0 f 3 3 Separation level1 indicating the end of region0 mapping; start of region0 is 0. Possible values for level1 are 0 to 13 (for dual RAQ) or 0 to 14 (for single RAQ) which corresponds to arqos. Note that for PA, arqos values are used directly as port priorities, where the higher the value corresponds to higher port priority. All of the map_level* registers must be set to distinct values.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_3@0XFD0706A4 31:0 33000f 100003 Port n Read QoS Configuration Register 0

    Register ( slcr )PCFGQOS1_3

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCFGQOS1_3 0XFD0706A8 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS1_3_RQOS_MAP_TIMEOUTR 26:16 7ff0000 0 0 Specifies the timeout value for transactions mapped to the red address queue.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS1_3_RQOS_MAP_TIMEOUTB 10:0 7ff 4f 4f Specifies the timeout value for transactions mapped to the blue address queue.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS1_3@0XFD0706A8 31:0 7ff07ff 4f Port n Read QoS Configuration Register 1

    Register ( slcr )PCFGWQOS0_3

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCFGWQOS0_3 0XFD0706AC 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGWQOS0_3_WQOS_MAP_REGION1 21:20 300000 1 100000 This bitfield indicates the traffic class of region 1. Valid values are: 0: NPW, 1: VPW. When VPW support is disabled (UMCTL2_VPW_EN = 0) and traffic class of region 1 is set to 1 (VPW), VPW traffic is aliased to LPW traffic.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGWQOS0_3_WQOS_MAP_REGION0 17:16 30000 0 0 This bitfield indicates the traffic class of region 0. Valid values are: 0: NPW, 1: VPW. When VPW support is disabled (UMCTL2_VPW_EN = 0) and traffic class of region0 is set to 1 (VPW), VPW traffic is aliased to NPW traffic.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGWQOS0_3_WQOS_MAP_LEVEL 3:0 f 3 3 Separation level indicating the end of region0 mapping; start of region0 is 0. Possible values for level1 are 0 to 14 which corresponds to awqos. Note that for PA, awqos values are used directly as port priorities, where the higher the value corresponds to higher port priority.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGWQOS0_3@0XFD0706AC 31:0 33000f 100003 Port n Write QoS Configuration Register 0

    PSU_DDRC_PCFGR_4_RD_PORT_PRIORITY 9:0 3ff f f Determines the initial load value of read aging counters.     PSU_DDRC_PCFGW_5_WR_PORT_AGING_EN 12:12 1000 0 0 If set to 1, enables aging function for the write channel of the port.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGW_5_WR_PORT_PRIORITY 9:0 3ff f f Determines the initial load value of write aging counters. These counters will be parallel loaded after reset, or after each grant to the corresponding port. The aging counters down-count every clock cycle where the port is requesting but not granted. The higher significant 5-bits of the write aging counter sets the initial priority of the write channel of a given port. Port's priority will increase as the higher significant 5-bits of the counter starts to decrease. When the aging counter becomes 0, the corresponding port channel will have the highest priority level. For multi-port configurations, the aging counters cannot be used to set port priorities when external dynamic priority inputs (awqos) are enabled (timeout is still applicable). For single port configurations, the aging counters are only used when they timeout (become 0) to force read-write direction switching. Note: The two LSBs of this register field are tied internally to 2'b00.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGW_5@0XFD070778 31:0 73ff 600f Port n Configuration Write Register

    Register ( slcr )PCTRL_5

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCTRL_5 0XFD070800 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCTRL_5_PORT_EN 0:0 1 1 1 Enables port n.
    PSU_DDRC_PCTRL_5@0XFD070800 31:0 1 1 Port n Control Register

    Register ( slcr )PCFGQOS0_5

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCFGQOS0_5 0XFD070804 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_5_RQOS_MAP_REGION1 21:20 300000 1 100000 This bitfield indicates the traffic class of region 1. Valid values are: 0 : LPR, 1: VPR, 2: HPR. For dual address queue configurations, region1 maps to the blue address queue. In this case, valid values are 0: LPR and 1: VPR only. When VPR support is disabled (UMCTL2_VPR_EN = 0) and traffic class of region 1 is set to 1 (VPR), VPR traffic is aliased to LPR traffic.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_5_RQOS_MAP_REGION0 17:16 30000 0 0 This bitfield indicates the traffic class of region 0. Valid values are: 0: LPR, 1: VPR, 2: HPR. For dual address queue configurations, region 0 maps to the blue address queue. In this case, valid values are: 0: LPR and 1: VPR only. When VPR support is disabled (UMCTL2_VPR_EN = 0) and traffic class of region0 is set to 1 (VPR), VPR traffic is aliased to LPR traffic.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_5_RQOS_MAP_LEVEL1 3:0 f 3 3 Separation level1 indicating the end of region0 mapping; start of region0 is 0. Possible values for level1 are 0 to 13 (for dual RAQ) or 0 to 14 (for single RAQ) which corresponds to arqos. Note that for PA, arqos values are used directly as port priorities, where the higher the value corresponds to higher port priority. All of the map_level* registers must be set to distinct values.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS0_5@0XFD070804 31:0 33000f 100003 Port n Read QoS Configuration Register 0

    Register ( slcr )PCFGQOS1_5

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCFGQOS1_5 0XFD070808 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS1_5_RQOS_MAP_TIMEOUTR 26:16 7ff0000 0 0 Specifies the timeout value for transactions mapped to the red address queue.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS1_5_RQOS_MAP_TIMEOUTB 10:0 7ff 4f 4f Specifies the timeout value for transactions mapped to the blue address queue.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGQOS1_5@0XFD070808 31:0 7ff07ff 4f Port n Read QoS Configuration Register 1

    Register ( slcr )PCFGWQOS0_5

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PCFGWQOS0_5 0XFD07080C 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGWQOS0_5_WQOS_MAP_REGION1 21:20 300000 1 100000 This bitfield indicates the traffic class of region 1. Valid values are: 0: NPW, 1: VPW. When VPW support is disabled (UMCTL2_VPW_EN = 0) and traffic class of region 1 is set to 1 (VPW), VPW traffic is aliased to LPW traffic.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGWQOS0_5_WQOS_MAP_REGION0 17:16 30000 0 0 This bitfield indicates the traffic class of region 0. Valid values are: 0: NPW, 1: VPW. When VPW support is disabled (UMCTL2_VPW_EN = 0) and traffic class of region0 is set to 1 (VPW), VPW traffic is aliased to NPW traffic.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGWQOS0_5_WQOS_MAP_LEVEL 3:0 f 3 3 Separation level indicating the end of region0 mapping; start of region0 is 0. Possible values for level1 are 0 to 14 which corresponds to awqos. Note that for PA, awqos values are used directly as port priorities, where the higher the value corresponds to higher port priority.
    PSU_DDRC_PCFGWQOS0_5@0XFD07080C 31:0 33000f 100003 Port n Write QoS Configuration Register 0

    Register ( slcr )PCFGWQOS1_5

    PSU_DDRC_PCFGWQOS1_5@0XFD070810 31:0 7ff 4f Port n Write QoS Configuration Register 1

    Register ( slcr )SARBASE0

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    SARBASE0 0XFD070F04 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_SARBASE0_BASE_ADDR 8:0 1ff 0 0 Base address for address region n specified as awaddr[UMCTL2_A_ADDRW-1:x] and araddr[UMCTL2_A_ADDRW-1:x] where x is determined by the minimum block size parameter UMCTL2_SARMINSIZE: (x=log2(block size)).
    PSU_DDRC_SARBASE0@0XFD070F04 31:0 1ff 0 SAR Base Address Register n

    Register ( slcr )SARSIZE0

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    SARSIZE0 0XFD070F08 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_SARSIZE0_NBLOCKS 7:0 ff 0 0 Number of blocks for address region n. This register determines the total size of the region in multiples of minimum block size as specified by the hardware parameter UMCTL2_SARMINSIZE. The register value is encoded as number of blocks = nblocks + 1. For example, if register is programmed to 0, region will have 1 block.
    PSU_DDRC_SARSIZE0@0XFD070F08 31:0 ff 0 SAR Size Register n

    Register ( slcr )SARBASE1

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    SARBASE1 0XFD070F0C 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_SARBASE1_BASE_ADDR 8:0 1ff 10 10 Base address for address region n specified as awaddr[UMCTL2_A_ADDRW-1:x] and araddr[UMCTL2_A_ADDRW-1:x] where x is determined by the minimum block size parameter UMCTL2_SARMINSIZE: (x=log2(block size)).
    PSU_DDRC_SARBASE1@0XFD070F0C 31:0 1ff 10 SAR Base Address Register n

    Register ( slcr )SARSIZE1

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    SARSIZE1 0XFD070F10 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_SARSIZE1_NBLOCKS 7:0 ff f f Number of blocks for address region n. This register determines the total size of the region in multiples of minimum block size as specified by the hardware parameter UMCTL2_SARMINSIZE. The register value is encoded as number of blocks = nblocks + 1. For example, if register is programmed to 0, region will have 1 block.
    PSU_DDRC_SARSIZE1@0XFD070F10 31:0 ff f SAR Size Register n

    Register ( slcr )DFITMG0_SHADOW

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    DFITMG0_SHADOW 0XFD072190 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_DFITMG0_SHADOW_DFI_T_CTRL_DELAY 28:24 1f000000 7 7000000 Specifies the number of DFI clock cycles after an assertion or de-assertion of the DFI control signals that the control signals at the PHY-DRAM interface reflect the assertion or de-assertion. If the DFI clock and the memory clock are not phase-aligned, this timing parameter should be rounded up to the next integer value. Note that if using RDIMM, it is necessary to increment this parameter by RDIMM's extra cycle of latency in terms of DFI clock.
    PSU_DDRC_DFITMG0_SHADOW_DFI_RDDATA_USE_SDR 23:23 800000 1 800000 Defines whether dfi_rddata_en/dfi_rddata/dfi_rddata_valid is generated using HDR or SDR values Selects whether value in DFITMG0.dfi_t_rddata_en is in terms of SDR or HDR clock cycles: - 0 in terms of HDR clock cycles - 1 in terms of SDR clock cycles Refer to PHY specification for correct value.
    PSU_DDRC_DFITMG0_SHADOW_DFI_T_RDDATA_EN 21:16 3f0000 2 20000 Time from the assertion of a read command on the DFI interface to the assertion of the dfi_rddata_en signal. Refer to PHY specification for correct value. This corresponds to the DFI parameter trddata_en. Note that, depending on the PHY, if using RDIMM, it may be necessary to use the value (CL + 1) in the calculation of trddata_en. This is to compensate for the extra cycle of latency through the RDIMM. Unit: Clocks
    PSU_DDRC_DFITMG0_SHADOW_DFI_WRDATA_USE_SDR 15:15 8000 1 8000 Defines whether dfi_wrdata_en/dfi_wrdata/dfi_wrdata_mask is generated using HDR or SDR values Selects whether value in DFITMG0.dfi_tphy_wrlat is in terms of SDR or HDR clock cycles Selects whether value in DFITMG0.dfi_tphy_wrdata is in terms of SDR or HDR clock cycles - 0 in terms of HDR clock cycles - 1 in terms of SDR clock cycles Refer to PHY specification for correct value.
    PSU_DDRC_DFITMG0_SHADOW_DFI_TPHY_WRDATA 13:8 3f00 0 0 Specifies the number of clock cycles between when dfi_wrdata_en is asserted to when the associated write data is driven on the dfi_wrdata signal. This corresponds to the DFI timing parameter tphy_wrdata. Refer to PHY specification for correct value. Note, max supported value is 8. Unit: Clocks
    PSU_DDRC_DFITMG0_SHADOW_DFI_TPHY_WRLAT 5:0 3f 2 2 Write latency Number of clocks from the write command to write data enable (dfi_wrdata_en). This corresponds to the DFI timing parameter tphy_wrlat. Refer to PHY specification for correct value.Note that, depending on the PHY, if using RDIMM, it may be necessary to use the value (CL + 1) in the calculation of tphy_wrlat. This is to compensate for the extra cycle of latency through the RDIMM.
    PSU_DDRC_DFITMG0_SHADOW@0XFD072190 31:0 1fbfbf3f 7828002 DFI Timing Shadow Register 0

    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTPR5_RESERVED_31_24 31:24 ff000000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.

    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTPR5_RESERVED_15 15:15 8000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTPR5_TRCD 14:8 7f00 f f00 Activate to read or write delay
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTPR5_RESERVED_7_5 7:5 e0 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTPR5_TWTR 4:0 1f 9 9 Internal write to read command delay
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTPR5@0XFD080124 31:0 ffffffff 320f09 DRAM Timing Parameters Register 5

    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX1GCR4_RESERVED_31_29 31:29 e0000000 0 0 Byte lane VREF IOM (Used only by D4MU IOs)
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX1GCR4_DXREFPEN 28:28 10000000 0 0 Byte Lane VREF Pad Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX1GCR4_DXREFEEN 27:26 c000000 3 c000000 Byte Lane Internal VREF Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX1GCR4_DXREFSEN 25:25 2000000 1 2000000 Byte Lane Single-End VREF Enable

    Register ( slcr )DX2GCR0

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    DX2GCR0 0XFD080900 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_CALBYP 31:31 80000000 0 0 Calibration Bypass
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_MDLEN 30:30 40000000 1 40000000 Master Delay Line Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_CODTSHFT 29:28 30000000 0 0 Configurable ODT(TE) Phase Shift
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_DQSDCC 27:24 f000000 0 0 DQS Duty Cycle Correction
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_RDDLY 23:20 f00000 8 800000 Number of Cycles ( in terms of ctl_clk) to generate ctl_dx_get_static_rd input for the respective bypte lane of the PHY
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_RESERVED_19_14 19:14 fc000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_DQSNSEPDR 13:13 2000 0 0 DQSNSE Power Down Receiver
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_DQSSEPDR 12:12 1000 0 0 DQSSE Power Down Receiver
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_RTTOAL 11:11 800 0 0 RTT On Additive Latency
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_RTTOH 10:9 600 3 600 RTT Output Hold
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_CPDRSHFT 8:7 180 0 0 Configurable PDR Phase Shift
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_DQSRPD 6:6 40 0 0 DQSR Power Down
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_DQSGPDR 5:5 20 0 0 DQSG Power Down Receiver
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_RESERVED_4 4:4 10 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_DQSGODT 3:3 8 0 0 DQSG On-Die Termination
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_DQSGOE 2:2 4 1 4 DQSG Output Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0_RESERVED_1_0 1:0 3 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR0@0XFD080900 31:0 ffffffff 40800604 DATX8 n General Configuration Register 0

    Register ( slcr )DX2GCR1

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    DX2GCR1 0XFD080904 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR1_DXPDRMODE 31:16 ffff0000 0 0 Enables the PDR mode for DQ[7:0]
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR1_RESERVED_15 15:15 8000 0 0 Reserved. Returns zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR1_QSNSEL 14:14 4000 1 4000 Select the delayed or non-delayed read data strobe #
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR1_QSSEL 13:13 2000 1 2000 Select the delayed or non-delayed read data strobe
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR1_OEEN 12:12 1000 1 1000 Enables Read Data Strobe in a byte lane
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR1_PDREN 11:11 800 1 800 Enables PDR in a byte lane
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR1_TEEN 10:10 400 1 400 Enables ODT/TE in a byte lane
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR1_DSEN 9:9 200 1 200 Enables Write Data strobe in a byte lane
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR1_DMEN 8:8 100 1 100 Enables DM pin in a byte lane
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR1_DQEN 7:0 ff ff ff Enables DQ corresponding to each bit in a byte
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX2GCR1@0XFD080904 31:0 ffffffff 7fff DATX8 n General Configuration Register 1

    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX3GTR0_RESERVED_23_20 23:20 f00000 0 0 Reserved. Caution, do not write to this register field.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX3GTR0_WLSL 19:16 f0000 2 20000 Write Leveling System Latency
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX3GTR0_RESERVED_15_13 15:13 e000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX3GTR0_RESERVED_12_8 12:8 1f00 0 0 Reserved. Caution, do not write to this register field.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX3GTR0_RESERVED_7_5 7:5 e0 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX3GTR0_DGSL 4:0 1f 0 0 DQS Gating System Latency
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX3GTR0@0XFD080AC0 31:0 ffffffff 20000 DATX8 n General Timing Register 0

    Register ( slcr )DX4GCR0

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    DX4GCR0 0XFD080B00 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_CALBYP 31:31 80000000 0 0 Calibration Bypass
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_MDLEN 30:30 40000000 1 40000000 Master Delay Line Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_CODTSHFT 29:28 30000000 0 0 Configurable ODT(TE) Phase Shift
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_DQSDCC 27:24 f000000 0 0 DQS Duty Cycle Correction
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_RDDLY 23:20 f00000 8 800000 Number of Cycles ( in terms of ctl_clk) to generate ctl_dx_get_static_rd input for the respective bypte lane of the PHY
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_RESERVED_19_14 19:14 fc000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_DQSNSEPDR 13:13 2000 0 0 DQSNSE Power Down Receiver
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_DQSSEPDR 12:12 1000 0 0 DQSSE Power Down Receiver
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_RTTOAL 11:11 800 0 0 RTT On Additive Latency
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_RTTOH 10:9 600 3 600 RTT Output Hold
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_CPDRSHFT 8:7 180 0 0 Configurable PDR Phase Shift
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_DQSRPD 6:6 40 0 0 DQSR Power Down
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_DQSGPDR 5:5 20 0 0 DQSG Power Down Receiver
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_RESERVED_4 4:4 10 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_DQSGODT 3:3 8 0 0 DQSG On-Die Termination
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_DQSGOE 2:2 4 1 4 DQSG Output Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0_RESERVED_1_0 1:0 3 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR0@0XFD080B00 31:0 ffffffff 40800604 DATX8 n General Configuration Register 0

    Register ( slcr )DX4GCR1

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    DX4GCR1 0XFD080B04 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR1_DXPDRMODE 31:16 ffff0000 0 0 Enables the PDR mode for DQ[7:0]
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR1_RESERVED_15 15:15 8000 0 0 Reserved. Returns zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR1_QSNSEL 14:14 4000 1 4000 Select the delayed or non-delayed read data strobe #
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR1_QSSEL 13:13 2000 1 2000 Select the delayed or non-delayed read data strobe
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR1_OEEN 12:12 1000 1 1000 Enables Read Data Strobe in a byte lane
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR1_PDREN 11:11 800 1 800 Enables PDR in a byte lane
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR1_TEEN 10:10 400 1 400 Enables ODT/TE in a byte lane
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR1_DSEN 9:9 200 1 200 Enables Write Data strobe in a byte lane
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR1_DMEN 8:8 100 1 100 Enables DM pin in a byte lane
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR1_DQEN 7:0 ff ff ff Enables DQ corresponding to each bit in a byte
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR1@0XFD080B04 31:0 ffffffff 7fff DATX8 n General Configuration Register 1

    Register ( slcr )DX4GCR4

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    DX4GCR4 0XFD080B10 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR4_RESERVED_31_29 31:29 e0000000 0 0 Byte lane VREF IOM (Used only by D4MU IOs)
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR4_DXREFPEN 28:28 10000000 0 0 Byte Lane VREF Pad Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR4_DXREFEEN 27:26 c000000 3 c000000 Byte Lane Internal VREF Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR4_DXREFSEN 25:25 2000000 1 2000000 Byte Lane Single-End VREF Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR4_RESERVED_24 24:24 1000000 0 0 Reserved. Returns zeros on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR4_DXREFESELRANGE 23:23 800000 0 0 External VREF generator REFSEL range select
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR4_DXREFESEL 22:16 7f0000 0 0 Byte Lane External VREF Select
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR4_DXREFSSELRANGE 15:15 8000 1 8000 Single ended VREF generator REFSEL range select
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR4_DXREFSSEL 14:8 7f00 30 3000 Byte Lane Single-End VREF Select
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR4_RESERVED_7_6 7:6 c0 0 0 Reserved. Returns zeros on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR4_DXREFIEN 5:2 3c f 3c VREF Enable control for DQ IO (Single Ended) buffers of a byte lane.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR4_DXREFIMON 1:0 3 0 0 VRMON control for DQ IO (Single Ended) buffers of a byte lane.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX4GCR4@0XFD080B10 31:0 ffffffff e00b03c DATX8 n General Configuration Register 4

    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX6GCR4_DXREFESELRANGE 23:23 800000 0 0 External VREF generator REFSEL range select
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX6GCR4_DXREFESEL 22:16 7f0000 0 0 Byte Lane External VREF Select
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX6GCR4_DXREFSSELRANGE 15:15 8000 1 8000 Single ended VREF generator REFSEL range select
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX6GCR4_DXREFSSEL 14:8 7f00 30 3000 Byte Lane Single-End VREF Select
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX6GCR4_RESERVED_7_6 7:6 c0 0 0 Reserved. Returns zeros on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX6GCR4_DXREFIEN 5:2 3c f 3c VREF Enable control for DQ IO (Single Ended) buffers of a byte lane.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX6GCR4_DXREFIMON 1:0 3 0 0 VRMON control for DQ IO (Single Ended) buffers of a byte lane.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX6GCR4@0XFD080D10 31:0 ffffffff e00b03c DATX8 n General Configuration Register 4

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_CALBYP 31:31 80000000 0 0 Calibration Bypass
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_MDLEN 30:30 40000000 1 40000000 Master Delay Line Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_CODTSHFT 29:28 30000000 0 0 Configurable ODT(TE) Phase Shift
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_DQSDCC 27:24 f000000 0 0 DQS Duty Cycle Correction
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_RDDLY 23:20 f00000 8 800000 Number of Cycles ( in terms of ctl_clk) to generate ctl_dx_get_static_rd input for the respective bypte lane of the PHY
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_RESERVED_19_14 19:14 fc000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_DQSNSEPDR 13:13 2000 0 0 DQSNSE Power Down Receiver
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_DQSSEPDR 12:12 1000 0 0 DQSSE Power Down Receiver
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_RTTOAL 11:11 800 0 0 RTT On Additive Latency
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_RTTOH 10:9 600 3 600 RTT Output Hold
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_CPDRSHFT 8:7 180 0 0 Configurable PDR Phase Shift
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_DQSRPD 6:6 40 0 0 DQSR Power Down
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_DQSGPDR 5:5 20 0 0 DQSG Power Down Receiver
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_RESERVED_4 4:4 10 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_DQSGODT 3:3 8 0 0 DQSG On-Die Termination
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_DQSGOE 2:2 4 1 4 DQSG Output Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR0_RESERVED_1_0 1:0 3 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.

    Register ( slcr )DX7GCR1

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    DX7GCR1 0XFD080E04 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR1_DXPDRMODE 31:16 ffff0000 0 0 Enables the PDR mode for DQ[7:0]
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR1_RESERVED_15 15:15 8000 0 0 Reserved. Returns zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR1_QSNSEL 14:14 4000 1 4000 Select the delayed or non-delayed read data strobe #
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR1_QSSEL 13:13 2000 1 2000 Select the delayed or non-delayed read data strobe
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR1_OEEN 12:12 1000 1 1000 Enables Read Data Strobe in a byte lane
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR1_PDREN 11:11 800 1 800 Enables PDR in a byte lane
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR1_TEEN 10:10 400 1 400 Enables ODT/TE in a byte lane
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR1_DSEN 9:9 200 1 200 Enables Write Data strobe in a byte lane
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR1_DMEN 8:8 100 1 100 Enables DM pin in a byte lane
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR1_DQEN 7:0 ff ff ff Enables DQ corresponding to each bit in a byte
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX7GCR1@0XFD080E04 31:0 ffffffff 7fff DATX8 n General Configuration Register 1

    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8GTR0_RESERVED_12_8 12:8 1f00 0 0 Reserved. Caution, do not write to this register field.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8GTR0_RESERVED_7_5 7:5 e0 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8GTR0_DGSL 4:0 1f 0 0 DQS Gating System Latency
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8GTR0@0XFD080FC0 31:0 ffffffff 20000 DATX8 n General Timing Register 0

    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4IOCR_RESERVED_31 31:31 80000000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4IOCR_DXDACRANGE 30:28 70000000 7 70000000 PVREF_DAC REFSEL range select
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4IOCR_DXVREFIOM 27:25 e000000 0 0 IOM bits for PVREF, PVREF_DAC and PVREFE cells in DX IO ring
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4IOCR_DXIOM 24:22 1c00000 2 800000 DX IO Mode
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4IOCR_DXTXM 21:11 3ff800 0 0 DX IO Transmitter Mode
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4IOCR_DXRXM 10:0 7ff 0 0 DX IO Receiver Mode
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4IOCR@0XFD081530 31:0 ffffffff 70800000 DATX8 0-1 I/O Configuration Register

    Register ( slcr )DX8SLbDQSCTL

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    DX8SLbDQSCTL 0XFD0817DC 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SLBDQSCTL_RESERVED_31_25 31:25 fe000000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SLBDQSCTL_RRRMODE 24:24 1000000 1 1000000 Read Path Rise-to-Rise Mode
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SLBDQSCTL_RESERVED_23_22 23:22 c00000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SLBDQSCTL_WRRMODE 21:21 200000 1 200000 Write Path Rise-to-Rise Mode
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SLBDQSCTL_DQSGX 20:19 180000 0 0 DQS Gate Extension
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SLBDQSCTL_LPPLLPD 18:18 40000 1 40000 Low Power PLL Power Down
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SLBDQSCTL_LPIOPD 17:17 20000 1 20000 Low Power I/O Power Down
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SLBDQSCTL_RESERVED_16_15 16:15 18000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SLBDQSCTL_QSCNTEN 14:14 4000 1 4000 QS Counter Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SLBDQSCTL_UDQIOM 13:13 2000 0 0 Unused DQ I/O Mode
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SLBDQSCTL_RESERVED_12_10 12:10 1c00 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SLBDQSCTL_DXSR 9:8 300 3 300 Data Slew Rate
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SLBDQSCTL_DQSNRES 7:4 f0 c c0 DQS# Resistor
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SLBDQSCTL_DQSRES 3:0 f 4 4 DQS Resistor
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SLBDQSCTL@0XFD0817DC 31:0 ffffffff 12643c4 DATX8 0-8 DQS Control Register

    POLLING/TRANING FOR DDR PHY

    Register ( slcr )PIR

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PIR 0XFD080004 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_RESERVED_31 31:31 80000000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_ZCALBYP 30:30 40000000 0 0 Impedance Calibration Bypass
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_DCALPSE 29:29 20000000 0 0 Digital Delay Line (DDL) Calibration Pause
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_RESERVED_28_21 28:21 1fe00000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_DQS2DQ 20:20 100000 0 0 Write DQS2DQ Training
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_RDIMMINIT 19:19 80000 0 0 RDIMM Initialization
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_CTLDINIT 18:18 40000 1 40000 Controller DRAM Initialization
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_VREF 17:17 20000 0 0 VREF Training
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_SRD 16:16 10000 0 0 Static Read Training
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_WREYE 15:15 8000 0 0 Write Data Eye Training
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_RDEYE 14:14 4000 0 0 Read Data Eye Training
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_WRDSKW 13:13 2000 0 0 Write Data Bit Deskew
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_RDDSKW 12:12 1000 0 0 Read Data Bit Deskew
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_WLADJ 11:11 800 0 0 Write Leveling Adjust
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_QSGATE 10:10 400 0 0 Read DQS Gate Training
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_WL 9:9 200 0 0 Write Leveling
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_DRAMINIT 8:8 100 0 0 DRAM Initialization
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_DRAMRST 7:7 80 0 0 DRAM Reset (DDR3/DDR4/LPDDR4 Only)
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_PHYRST 6:6 40 1 40 PHY Reset
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_DCAL 5:5 20 1 20 Digital Delay Line (DDL) Calibration
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_PLLINIT 4:4 10 1 10 PLL Initialiazation
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_RESERVED_3 3:3 8 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_CA 2:2 4 0 0 CA Training
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_ZCAL 1:1 2 1 2 Impedance Calibration
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PIR_INIT 0:0 1 1 1 Initialization Trigger

    Register ( slcr )DFIMISC

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    DFIMISC 0XFD0701B0 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_DFIMISC_DFI_INIT_COMPLETE_EN 0:0 1 1 1 PHY initialization complete enable signal. When asserted the dfi_init_complete signal can be used to trigger SDRAM initialisation
    PSU_DDRC_DFIMISC@0XFD0701B0 31:0 1 1 DFI Miscellaneous Control Register

    Register ( slcr )SWCTL

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    SWCTL 0XFD070320 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_SWCTL_SW_DONE 0:0 1 1 1 Enable quasi-dynamic register programming outside reset. Program register to 0 to enable quasi-dynamic programming. Set back register to 1 once programming is done.
    PSU_DDRC_SWCTL@0XFD070320 31:0 1 1 Software register programming control enable

    POLL FOR DDR INIT

    Register ( slcr )STAT

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    STAT 0XFD070004 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_STAT_OPERATING_MODE 2:0 7 1 1 Operating mode. This is 3-bits wide in configurations with mDDR/LPDDR2/LPDDR3/LPDDR4/DDR4 support and 2-bits in all other configurations. non-mDDR/LPDDR2/LPDDR3/LPDDR4 and non-DDR4 designs: - 00 - Init - 01 - Normal - 10 - Power-down - 11 - Self refresh mDDR/LPDDR2/LPDDR3 or DDR4 designs: - 000 - Init - 001 - Normal - 010 - Power-down - 011 - Self refresh - 1XX - Deep power-down / Maximum Power Saving Mode LPDDR4 designs: - 000 - Init - 001 - Normal - 010 - Power-down - 011 - Self refresh / Self refresh power-down
    PSU_DDRC_STAT@0XFD070004 31:0 7 1 tobe

    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL0DXCTL2_IOAG 16:16 10000 0 0 I/O Assisted Gate Select
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL0DXCTL2_IOLB 15:15 8000 0 0 I/O Loopback Select
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL0DXCTL2_RESERVED_14_13 14:13 6000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL0DXCTL2_LPWAKEUP_THRSH 12:9 1e00 c 1800 Low Power Wakeup Threshold
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL0DXCTL2_RDBI 8:8 100 0 0 Read Data Bus Inversion Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL0DXCTL2_WDBI 7:7 80 0 0 Write Data Bus Inversion Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL0DXCTL2_PRFBYP 6:6 40 0 0 PUB Read FIFO Bypass
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL0DXCTL2_RDMODE 5:4 30 3 30 DATX8 Receive FIFO Read Mode
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL0DXCTL2_DISRST 3:3 8 0 0 Disables the Read FIFO Reset
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL0DXCTL2_DQSGLB 2:1 6 0 0 Read DQS Gate I/O Loopback
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL0DXCTL2_RESERVED_0 0:0 1 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL0DXCTL2@0XFD08142C 31:0 ffffffff 1830 DATX8 0-1 DX Control Register 2

    POLL FOR DDR PHY

    Register ( slcr )PGSR0

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PGSR0 0XFD080030 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PGSR0_IDONE 0:0 1 1 1 Initialization Done
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PGSR0@0XFD080030 31:0 1 1 tobe

    POLL FOR DDR PHY

    Register ( slcr )PGSR0

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PGSR0 0XFD080030 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PGSR0_PLDONE 1:1 2 1 2 PLL Lock Done
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PGSR0@0XFD080030 31:0 2 2 tobe

    POLL FOR DDR PHY

    Register ( slcr )PGSR0

    PSU_DDR_PHY_PGSR0_DCDONE 2:2 4 1 4 Digital Delay Line (DDL) Calibration Done
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PGSR0@0XFD080030 31:0 4 4 tobe

    PSU_DDR_PHY_PGSR0@0XFD080030 31:0 8 8 tobe

    RUN VREF TRAINING IN STATIC READ MODE

    Register ( slcr )DTCR0

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    DTCR0 0XFD080200 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_RFSHDT 31:28 f0000000 8 80000000 Refresh During Training
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_RESERVED_27_26 27:26 c000000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_DTDRS 25:24 3000000 1 1000000 Data Training Debug Rank Select
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_DTEXG 23:23 800000 0 0 Data Training with Early/Extended Gate
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_DTEXD 22:22 400000 0 0 Data Training Extended Write DQS
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_DTDSTP 21:21 200000 0 0 Data Training Debug Step
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_DTDEN 20:20 100000 0 0 Data Training Debug Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_DTDBS 19:16 f0000 0 0 Data Training Debug Byte Select
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_DTRDBITR 15:14 c000 2 8000 Data Training read DBI deskewing configuration
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_RESERVED_13 13:13 2000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_DTWBDDM 12:12 1000 1 1000 Data Training Write Bit Deskew Data Mask
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_RFSHEN 11:8 f00 1 100 Refreshes Issued During Entry to Training
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_DTCMPD 7:7 80 1 80 Data Training Compare Data
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_DTMPR 6:6 40 1 40 Data Training Using MPR
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_RESERVED_5_4 5:4 30 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0_DTRPTN 3:0 f 7 7 Data Training Repeat Number
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DTCR0@0XFD080200 31:0 ffffffff 810091c7 Data Training Configuration Register 0

    PSU_DDR_PHY_PGCR2_DTPMXTMR 27:20 ff00000 f f00000 Data Training PUB Mode Exit Timer
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PGCR2_INITFSMBYP 19:19 80000 0 0 Initialization Bypass
    PSU_DDR_PHY_PGCR2_PLLFSMBYP 18:18 40000 0 0 PLL FSM Bypass

    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4DXCTL2_POSOEX 22:20 700000 0 0 OX Extension during Post-amble
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4DXCTL2_PREOEX 19:18 c0000 0 0 OE Extension during Pre-amble
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4DXCTL2_RESERVED_17 17:17 20000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4DXCTL2_IOAG 16:16 10000 0 0 I/O Assisted Gate Select
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4DXCTL2_IOLB 15:15 8000 0 0 I/O Loopback Select
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4DXCTL2_RESERVED_14_13 14:13 6000 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4DXCTL2_LPWAKEUP_THRSH 12:9 1e00 c 1800 Low Power Wakeup Threshold
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4DXCTL2_RDBI 8:8 100 0 0 Read Data Bus Inversion Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4DXCTL2_WDBI 7:7 80 0 0 Write Data Bus Inversion Enable
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4DXCTL2_PRFBYP 6:6 40 0 0 PUB Read FIFO Bypass
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4DXCTL2_RDMODE 5:4 30 0 0 DATX8 Receive FIFO Read Mode
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4DXCTL2_DISRST 3:3 8 0 0 Disables the Read FIFO Reset
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4DXCTL2_DQSGLB 2:1 6 0 0 Read DQS Gate I/O Loopback
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4DXCTL2_RESERVED_0 0:0 1 0 0 Reserved. Return zeroes on reads.
    PSU_DDR_PHY_DX8SL4DXCTL2@0XFD08152C 31:0 ffffffff 1800 DATX8 0-1 DX Control Register 2

    Register ( slcr )ZQCTL0

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    ZQCTL0 0XFD070180 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_ZQCTL0_DIS_AUTO_ZQ 31:31 80000000 0 0 - 1 - Disable uMCTL2 generation of ZQCS/MPC(ZQ calibration) command. Register DBGCMD.zq_calib_short can be used instead to issue ZQ calibration request from APB module. - 0 - Internally generate ZQCS/MPC(ZQ calibration) commands based on ZQCTL1.t_zq_short_interval_x1024. This is only present for designs supporting DDR3/DDR4 or LPDDR2/LPDDR3/LPDDR4 devices.
    PSU_DDRC_ZQCTL0_DIS_SRX_ZQCL 30:30 40000000 0 0 - 1 - Disable issuing of ZQCL/MPC(ZQ calibration) command at Self-Refresh/SR-Powerdown exit. Only applicable when run in DDR3 or DDR4 or LPDDR2 or LPDDR3 or LPDDR4 mode. - 0 - Enable issuing of ZQCL/MPC(ZQ calibration) command at Self-Refresh/SR-Powerdown exit. Only applicable when run in DDR3 or DDR4 or LPDDR2 or LPDDR3 or LPDDR4 mode. This is only present for designs supporting DDR3/DDR4 or LPDDR2/LPDDR3/LPDDR4 devices.
    PSU_DDRC_ZQCTL0_ZQ_RESISTOR_SHARED 29:29 20000000 0 0 - 1 - Denotes that ZQ resistor is shared between ranks. Means ZQinit/ZQCL/ZQCS/MPC(ZQ calibration) commands are sent to one rank at a time with tZQinit/tZQCL/tZQCS/tZQCAL/tZQLAT timing met between commands so that commands to different ranks do not overlap. - 0 - ZQ resistor is not shared. This is only present for designs supporting DDR3/DDR4 or LPDDR2/LPDDR3/LPDDR4 devices.
    PSU_DDRC_ZQCTL0_DIS_MPSMX_ZQCL 28:28 10000000 0 0 - 1 - Disable issuing of ZQCL command at Maximum Power Saving Mode exit. Only applicable when run in DDR4 mode. - 0 - Enable issuing of ZQCL command at Maximum Power Saving Mode exit. Only applicable when run in DDR4 mode. This is only present for designs supporting DDR4 devices.
    PSU_DDRC_ZQCTL0_T_ZQ_LONG_NOP 26:16 7ff0000 100 1000000 tZQoper for DDR3/DDR4, tZQCL for LPDDR2/LPDDR3, tZQCAL for LPDDR4: Number of cycles of NOP required after a ZQCL (ZQ calibration long)/MPC(ZQ Start) command is issued to SDRAM. For configurations with MEMC_FREQ_RATIO=2: DDR3/DDR4: program this to tZQoper/2 and round it up to the next integer value. LPDDR2/LPDDR3: program this to tZQCL/2 and round it up to the next integer value. LPDDR4: program this to tZQCAL/2 and round it up to the next integer value. Unit: Clock cycles. This is only present for designs supporting DDR3/DDR4 or LPDDR2/LPDDR3/LPDDR4 devices.
    PSU_DDRC_ZQCTL0_T_ZQ_SHORT_NOP 9:0 3ff 40 40 tZQCS for DDR3/DD4/LPDDR2/LPDDR3, tZQLAT for LPDDR4: Number of cycles of NOP required after a ZQCS (ZQ calibration short)/MPC(ZQ Latch) command is issued to SDRAM. For configurations with MEMC_FREQ_RATIO=2, program this to tZQCS/2 and round it up to the next integer value. Unit: Clock cycles. This is only present for designs supporting DDR3/DDR4 or LPDDR2/LPDDR3/LPDDR4 devices.
    PSU_DDRC_ZQCTL0@0XFD070180 31:0 f7ff03ff 1000040 ZQ Control Register 0

    Register ( slcr )RFSHCTL3

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    RFSHCTL3 0XFD070060 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_DDRC_RFSHCTL3_REFRESH_MODE 6:4 70 0 0 Fine Granularity Refresh Mode - 000 - Fixed 1x (Normal mode) - 001 - Fixed 2x - 010 - Fixed 4x - 101 - Enable on the fly 2x (not supported) - 110 - Enable on the fly 4x (not supported) - Everything else - reserved Note: The on-the-fly modes is not supported in this version of the uMCTL2. Note: This must be set up while the Controller is in reset or while the Controller is in self-refresh mode. Changing this during normal operation is not allowed. Making this a dynamic register will be supported in future version of the uMCTL2.
    PSU_DDRC_RFSHCTL3_REFRESH_UPDATE_LEVEL 1:1 2 0 0 Toggle this signal (either from 0 to 1 or from 1 to 0) to indicate that the refresh register(s) have been updated. The value is automatically updated when exiting reset, so it does not need to be toggled initially.
    PSU_DDRC_RFSHCTL3_DIS_AUTO_REFRESH 0:0 1 0 0 When '1', disable auto-refresh generated by the uMCTL2. When auto-refresh is disabled, the SoC core must generate refreshes using the registers reg_ddrc_rank0_refresh, reg_ddrc_rank1_refresh, reg_ddrc_rank2_refresh and reg_ddrc_rank3_refresh. When dis_auto_refresh transitions from 0 to 1, any pending refreshes are immediately scheduled by the uMCTL2. If DDR4 CRC/parity retry is enabled (CRCPARCTL1.crc_parity_retry_enable = 1), disable auto-refresh is not supported, and this bit must be set to '0'. This register field is changeable on the fly.
    PSU_DDRC_RFSHCTL3@0XFD070060 31:0 73 0 Refresh Control Register 3

    psu_mio_init_data

    MIO PROGRAMMING

    Register ( slcr )MIO_PIN_0

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    MIO_PIN_0 0XFF180000 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_PIN_0_L0_SEL 1:1 2 1 2 Level 0 Mux Select 0= Level 1 Mux Output 1= qspi, Output, qspi_sclk_out- (QSPI Clock)
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_PIN_0_L1_SEL 2:2 4 0 0 Level 1 Mux Select 0= Level 2 Mux Output 1= Not Used
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_PIN_0_L2_SEL 4:3 18 0 0 Level 2 Mux Select 0= Level 3 Mux Output 1= Not Used 2= test_scan, Input, test_scan_in[0]- (Test Scan Port) = test_scan, Output, test_scan_out[0]- (Test Scan Port) 3= Not Used
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_PIN_0_L3_SEL 7:5 e0 0 0 Level 3 Mux Select 0= gpio0, Input, gpio_0_pin_in[0]- (GPIO bank 0) 0= gpio0, Output, gpio_0_pin_out[0]- (GPIO bank 0) 1= can1, Output, can1_phy_tx- (Can TX signal) 2= i2c1, Input, i2c1_scl_input- (SCL signal) 2= i2c1, Output, i2c1_scl_out- (SCL signal) 3= pjtag, Input, pjtag_tck- (PJTAG TCK) 4= spi0, Input, spi0_sclk_in- (SPI Clock) 4= spi0, Output, spi0_sclk_out- (SPI Clock) 5= ttc3, Input, ttc3_clk_in- (TTC Clock) 6= ua1, Output, ua1_txd- (UART transmitter serial output) 7= trace, Output, trace_clk- (Trace Port Clock)
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_PIN_0@0XFF180000 31:0 fe 2 Configures MIO Pin 0 peripheral interface mapping. S

    Register ( slcr )MIO_PIN_3

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    MIO_PIN_3 0XFF18000C 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_PIN_3_L0_SEL 1:1 2 1 2 Level 0 Mux Select 0= Level 1 Mux Output 1= qspi, Input, qspi_mi3- (QSPI Databus) 1= qspi, Output, qspi_mo3- (QSPI Databus)

    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_PIN_3_L2_SEL 4:3 18 0 0 Level 2 Mux Select 0= Level 3 Mux Output 1= Not Used 2= test_scan, Input, test_scan_in[3]- (Test Scan Port) = test_scan, Output, test_scan_out[3]- (Test Scan Port) 3= Not Used
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_PIN_3_L3_SEL 7:5 e0 0 0 Level 3 Mux Select 0= gpio0, Input, gpio_0_pin_in[3]- (GPIO bank 0) 0= gpio0, Output, gpio_0_pin_out[3]- (GPIO bank 0) 1= can0, Output, can0_phy_tx- (Can TX signal) 2= i2c0, Input, i2c0_sda_input- (SDA signal) 2= i2c0, Output, i2c0_sda_out- (SDA signal) 3= pjtag, Input, pjtag_tms- (PJTAG TMS) 4= spi0, Input, spi0_n_ss_in- (SPI Master Selects) 4= spi0, Output, spi0_n_ss_out[0]- (SPI Master Selects) 5= ttc2, Output, ttc2_wave_out- (TTC Waveform Clock) 6= ua0, Output, ua0_txd- (UART transmitter serial output) 7= trace, Output, tracedq[1]- (Trace Port Databus)

    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_PIN_16_L3_SEL 7:5 e0 2 40 Level 3 Mux Select 0= gpio0, Input, gpio_0_pin_in[16]- (GPIO bank 0) 0= gpio0, Output, gpio_0_pin_out[16]- (GPIO bank 0) 1= can1, Output, can1_phy_tx- (Can TX signal) 2= i2c1, Input, i2c1_scl_input- (SCL signal) 2= i2c1, Output, i2c1_scl_out- (SCL signal) 3= swdt1, Input, swdt1_clk_in- (Watch Dog Timer Input clock) 4= spi0, Input, spi0_mi- (MISO signal) 4= spi0, Output, spi0_so- (MISO signal) 5= ttc3, Input, ttc3_clk_in- (TTC Clock) 6= ua1, Output, ua1_txd- (UART transmitter serial output) 7= trace, Output, tracedq[14]- (Trace Port Databus)

    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_PIN_29_L2_SEL 4:3 18 0 0 Level 2 Mux Select 0= Level 3 Mux Output 1= pmu, Input, pmu_gpi[3]- (PMU GPI) 2= test_scan, Input, test_scan_in[29]- (Test Scan Port) = test_scan, Output, test_scan_out[29]- (Test Scan Port) 3= dpaux, Input, dp_aux_data_in- (Dp Aux Data) = dpaux, Output, dp_aux_data_out- (Dp Aux Data)
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_PIN_29_L3_SEL 7:5 e0 0 0 Level 3 Mux Select 0= gpio1, Input, gpio_1_pin_in[3]- (GPIO bank 1) 0= gpio1, Output, gpio_1_pin_out[3]- (GPIO bank 1) 1= can1, Input, can1_phy_rx- (Can RX signal) 2= i2c1, Input, i2c1_sda_input- (SDA signal) 2= i2c1, Output, i2c1_sda_out- (SDA signal) 3= pjtag, Input, pjtag_tms- (PJTAG TMS) 4= spi0, Input, spi0_n_ss_in- (SPI Master Selects) 4= spi0, Output, spi0_n_ss_out[0]- (SPI Master Selects) 5= ttc1, Output, ttc1_wave_out- (TTC Waveform Clock) 6= ua1, Input, ua1_rxd- (UART receiver serial input) 7= trace, Output, tracedq[7]- (Trace Port Databus)

    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_PIN_43_L2_SEL 4:3 18 2 10 Level 2 Mux Select 0= Level 3 Mux Output 1= sd0, Input, sd0_data_in[2]- (8-bit Data bus) = sd0, Output, sdio0_data_out[2]- (8-bit Data bus) 2= sd1, Output, sdio1_bus_pow- (SD card bus power) 3= Not Used
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_PIN_43_L3_SEL 7:5 e0 0 0 Level 3 Mux Select 0= gpio1, Input, gpio_1_pin_in[17]- (GPIO bank 1) 0= gpio1, Output, gpio_1_pin_out[17]- (GPIO bank 1) 1= can0, Output, can0_phy_tx- (Can TX signal) 2= i2c0, Input, i2c0_sda_input- (SDA signal) 2= i2c0, Output, i2c0_sda_out- (SDA signal) 3= swdt0, Output, swdt0_rst_out- (Watch Dog Timer Output clock) 4= spi0, Output, spi0_mo- (MOSI signal) 4= spi0, Input, spi0_si- (MOSI signal) 5= ttc2, Output, ttc2_wave_out- (TTC Waveform Clock) 6= ua0, Output, ua0_txd- (UART transmitter serial output) 7= trace, Output, tracedq[3]- (Trace Port Databus)

    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK1_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_25 25:25 2000000 1 2000000 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[26].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK1_CTRL5@0XFF180164 31:0 3ffffff 3ffffff When set, this enables mio_bank1_pullupdown to selects pull up or pull down for MIO Bank 1 - control MIO[51:26]

    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_9 9:9 200 1 200 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_10 10:10 400 1 400 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_11 11:11 800 1 800 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_12 12:12 1000 1 1000 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_13 13:13 2000 1 2000 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_14 14:14 4000 1 4000 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_15 15:15 8000 1 8000 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_16 16:16 10000 1 10000 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_17 17:17 20000 1 20000 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_18 18:18 40000 1 40000 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_19 19:19 80000 1 80000 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_20 20:20 100000 1 100000 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_21 21:21 200000 1 200000 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_22 22:22 400000 1 400000 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_23 23:23 800000 1 800000 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_24 24:24 1000000 1 1000000 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5_PULL_ENABLE_BIT_25 25:25 2000000 1 2000000 Each bit applies to a single IO. Bit 0 for MIO[52].
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_BANK2_CTRL5@0XFF180180 31:0 3ffffff 3ffffff When set, this enables mio_bank2_pullupdown to selects pull up or pull down for MIO Bank 2 - control MIO[77:52]

    LOOPBACK

    Register ( slcr )MIO_LOOPBACK

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    MIO_LOOPBACK 0XFF180200 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_LOOPBACK_I2C0_LOOP_I2C1 3:3 8 0 0 I2C Loopback Control. 0 = Connect I2C inputs according to MIO mapping. 1 = Loop I2C 0 outputs to I2C 1 inputs, and I2C 1 outputs to I2C 0 inputs.
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_LOOPBACK_CAN0_LOOP_CAN1 2:2 4 0 0 CAN Loopback Control. 0 = Connect CAN inputs according to MIO mapping. 1 = Loop CAN 0 Tx to CAN 1 Rx, and CAN 1 Tx to CAN 0 Rx.
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_LOOPBACK_UA0_LOOP_UA1 1:1 2 0 0 UART Loopback Control. 0 = Connect UART inputs according to MIO mapping. 1 = Loop UART 0 outputs to UART 1 inputs, and UART 1 outputs to UART 0 inputs. RXD/TXD cross-connected. RTS/CTS cross-connected. DSR, DTR, DCD and RI not used.
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_LOOPBACK_SPI0_LOOP_SPI1 0:0 1 0 0 SPI Loopback Control. 0 = Connect SPI inputs according to MIO mapping. 1 = Loop SPI 0 outputs to SPI 1 inputs, and SPI 1 outputs to SPI 0 inputs. The other SPI core will appear on the LS Slave Select.
    PSU_IOU_SLCR_MIO_LOOPBACK@0XFF180200 31:0 f 0 Loopback function within MIO

    psu_peripherals_init_data

    UPDATING TWO PCIE REGISTERS DEFAULT VALUES, AS THESE REGISTERS HAVE INCORRECT RESET VALUES IN SILICON.

    Register ( slcr )ATTR_37

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description

    Baud_rate_divider_reg0 0XFF000034 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_UART0_BAUD_RATE_DIVIDER_REG0_BDIV 7:0 ff 5 5 Baud rate divider value: 0 - 3: ignored 4 - 255: Baud rate
    PSU_UART0_BAUD_RATE_DIVIDER_REG0@0XFF000034 31:0 ff 5 Baud Rate Divider Register

    Register ( slcr )Baud_rate_gen_reg0

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    Baud_rate_gen_reg0 0XFF000018 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_UART0_BAUD_RATE_GEN_REG0_CD 15:0 ffff 8f 8f Baud Rate Clock Divisor Value: 0: Disables baud_sample 1: Clock divisor bypass (baud_sample = sel_clk) 2 - 65535: baud_sample
    PSU_UART0_BAUD_RATE_GEN_REG0@0XFF000018 31:0 ffff 8f Baud Rate Generator Register.

    Register ( slcr )Control_reg0

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    Control_reg0 0XFF000000 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_UART0_CONTROL_REG0_STPBRK 8:8 100 0 0 Stop transmitter break: 0: no affect 1: stop transmission of the break after a minimum of one character length and transmit a high level during 12 bit periods. It can be set regardless of the value of STTBRK.
    PSU_UART0_CONTROL_REG0_STTBRK 7:7 80 0 0 Start transmitter break: 0: no affect 1: start to transmit a break after the characters currently present in the FIFO and the transmit shift register have been transmitted. It can only be set if STPBRK (Stop transmitter break) is not high.
    PSU_UART0_CONTROL_REG0_RSTTO 6:6 40 0 0 Restart receiver timeout counter: 1: receiver timeout counter is restarted. This bit is self clearing once the restart has completed.
    PSU_UART0_CONTROL_REG0_TXDIS 5:5 20 0 0 Transmit disable: 0: enable transmitter 1: disable transmitter
    PSU_UART0_CONTROL_REG0_TXEN 4:4 10 1 10 Transmit enable: 0: disable transmitter 1: enable transmitter, provided the TXDIS field is set to 0.
    PSU_UART0_CONTROL_REG0_RXDIS 3:3 8 0 0 Receive disable: 0: enable 1: disable, regardless of the value of RXEN
    PSU_UART0_CONTROL_REG0_RXEN 2:2 4 1 4 Receive enable: 0: disable 1: enable When set to one, the receiver logic is enabled, provided the RXDIS field is set to zero.
    PSU_UART0_CONTROL_REG0_TXRES 1:1 2 1 2 Software reset for Tx data path: 0: no affect 1: transmitter logic is reset and all pending transmitter data is discarded This bit is self clearing once the reset has completed.
    PSU_UART0_CONTROL_REG0_RXRES 0:0 1 1 1 Software reset for Rx data path: 0: no affect 1: receiver logic is reset and all pending receiver data is discarded. This bit is self clearing once the reset has completed.
    PSU_UART0_CONTROL_REG0@0XFF000000 31:0 1ff 17 UART Control Register

    Register ( slcr )mode_reg0

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    mode_reg0 0XFF000004 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_UART0_MODE_REG0_CHMODE 9:8 300 0 0 Channel mode: Defines the mode of operation of the UART. 00: normal 01: automatic echo 10: local loopback 11: remote loopback
    PSU_UART0_MODE_REG0_NBSTOP 7:6 c0 0 0 Number of stop bits: Defines the number of stop bits to detect on receive and to generate on transmit. 00: 1 stop bit 01: 1.5 stop bits 10: 2 stop bits 11: reserved
    PSU_UART0_MODE_REG0_PAR 5:3 38 4 20 Parity type select: Defines the expected parity to check on receive and the parity to generate on transmit. 000: even parity 001: odd parity 010: forced to 0 parity (space) 011: forced to 1 parity (mark) 1xx: no parity
    PSU_UART0_MODE_REG0_CHRL 2:1 6 0 0 Character length select: Defines the number of bits in each character. 11: 6 bits 10: 7 bits 0x: 8 bits
    PSU_UART0_MODE_REG0_CLKS 0:0 1 0 0 Clock source select: This field defines whether a pre-scalar of 8 is applied to the baud rate generator input clock. 0: clock source is uart_ref_clk 1: clock source is uart_ref_clk/8
    PSU_UART0_MODE_REG0@0XFF000004 31:0 3ff 20 UART Mode Register

    Register ( slcr )Baud_rate_divider_reg0

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_UART1_BAUD_RATE_DIVIDER_REG0_BDIV 7:0 ff 5 5 Baud rate divider value: 0 - 3: ignored 4 - 255: Baud rate
    PSU_UART1_BAUD_RATE_DIVIDER_REG0@0XFF010034 31:0 ff 5 Baud Rate Divider Register

    Register ( slcr )Control_reg0

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    Control_reg0 0XFF010000 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_UART1_CONTROL_REG0_STPBRK 8:8 100 0 0 Stop transmitter break: 0: no affect 1: stop transmission of the break after a minimum of one character length and transmit a high level during 12 bit periods. It can be set regardless of the value of STTBRK.
    PSU_UART1_CONTROL_REG0_STTBRK 7:7 80 0 0 Start transmitter break: 0: no affect 1: start to transmit a break after the characters currently present in the FIFO and the transmit shift register have been transmitted. It can only be set if STPBRK (Stop transmitter break) is not high.
    PSU_UART1_CONTROL_REG0_RSTTO 6:6 40 0 0 Restart receiver timeout counter: 1: receiver timeout counter is restarted. This bit is self clearing once the restart has completed.
    PSU_UART1_CONTROL_REG0_TXDIS 5:5 20 0 0 Transmit disable: 0: enable transmitter 1: disable transmitter
    PSU_UART1_CONTROL_REG0_TXEN 4:4 10 1 10 Transmit enable: 0: disable transmitter 1: enable transmitter, provided the TXDIS field is set to 0.
    PSU_UART1_CONTROL_REG0_RXDIS 3:3 8 0 0 Receive disable: 0: enable 1: disable, regardless of the value of RXEN
    PSU_UART1_CONTROL_REG0_RXEN 2:2 4 1 4 Receive enable: 0: disable 1: enable When set to one, the receiver logic is enabled, provided the RXDIS field is set to zero.
    PSU_UART1_CONTROL_REG0_TXRES 1:1 2 1 2 Software reset for Tx data path: 0: no affect 1: transmitter logic is reset and all pending transmitter data is discarded This bit is self clearing once the reset has completed.
    PSU_UART1_CONTROL_REG0_RXRES 0:0 1 1 1 Software reset for Rx data path: 0: no affect 1: receiver logic is reset and all pending receiver data is discarded. This bit is self clearing once the reset has completed.
    PSU_UART1_CONTROL_REG0@0XFF010000 31:0 1ff 17 UART Control Register

    Register ( slcr )mode_reg0

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    mode_reg0 0XFF010004 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_UART1_MODE_REG0_CHMODE 9:8 300 0 0 Channel mode: Defines the mode of operation of the UART. 00: normal 01: automatic echo 10: local loopback 11: remote loopback
    PSU_UART1_MODE_REG0_NBSTOP 7:6 c0 0 0 Number of stop bits: Defines the number of stop bits to detect on receive and to generate on transmit. 00: 1 stop bit 01: 1.5 stop bits 10: 2 stop bits 11: reserved
    PSU_UART1_MODE_REG0_PAR 5:3 38 4 20 Parity type select: Defines the expected parity to check on receive and the parity to generate on transmit. 000: even parity 001: odd parity 010: forced to 0 parity (space) 011: forced to 1 parity (mark) 1xx: no parity
    PSU_UART1_MODE_REG0_CHRL 2:1 6 0 0 Character length select: Defines the number of bits in each character. 11: 6 bits 10: 7 bits 0x: 8 bits
    PSU_UART1_MODE_REG0_CLKS 0:0 1 0 0 Clock source select: This field defines whether a pre-scalar of 8 is applied to the baud rate generator input clock. 0: clock source is uart_ref_clk 1: clock source is uart_ref_clk/8

    PSU_SERDES_ICM_CFG0_L1_ICM_CFG 6:4 70 1 10 Controls UPHY Lane 1 protocol configuration. 0 - PowerDown, 1 - PCIe.1, 2 - Sata1, 3 - USB0, 4 - DP.0, 5 - SGMII1, 6 - Unused, 7 - Unused

    PCIE SETTINGS

    Register ( slcr )ATTR_7

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    ATTR_7 0XFD48001C 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_ATTR_7_ATTR_BAR0 15:0 ffff 0 0 Specifies mask/settings for Base Address Register (BAR) 0. If BAR is not to be implemented, set to 32'h00000000. Bits are defined as follows: Memory Space BAR [0] = Mem Space Indicator (set to 0) [2:1] = Type field (10 for 64-bit, 00 for 32-bit) [3] = Prefetchable (0 or 1) [31:4] = Mask for writable bits of BAR; if 32-bit BAR, set uppermost 31:n bits to 1, where 2^n=memory aperture size in bytes. If 64-bit BAR, set uppermost 63:n bits of \'7bBAR1,BAR0\'7d to 1. IO Space BAR 0] = IO Space Indicator (set to 1) [1] = Reserved (set to 0) [31:2] = Mask for writable bits of BAR; set uppermost 31:n bits to 1, where 2^n=i/o aperture size in bytes.; EP=0x0004; RP=0x0000
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_ATTR_7@0XFD48001C 31:0 ffff 0 ATTR_7

    Register ( slcr )ATTR_8

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    ATTR_8 0XFD480020 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_ATTR_8_ATTR_BAR0 15:0 ffff fff0 fff0 Specifies mask/settings for Base Address Register (BAR) 0. If BAR is not to be implemented, set to 32'h00000000. Bits are defined as follows: Memory Space BAR [0] = Mem Space Indicator (set to 0) [2:1] = Type field (10 for 64-bit, 00 for 32-bit) [3] = Prefetchable (0 or 1) [31:4] = Mask for writable bits of BAR; if 32-bit BAR, set uppermost 31:n bits to 1, where 2^n=memory aperture size in bytes. If 64-bit BAR, set uppermost 63:n bits of \'7bBAR1,BAR0\'7d to 1. IO Space BAR 0] = IO Space Indicator (set to 1) [1] = Reserved (set to 0) [31:2] = Mask for writable bits of BAR; set uppermost 31:n bits to 1, where 2^n=i/o aperture size in bytes.; EP=0xFFF0; RP=0x0000
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_ATTR_8@0XFD480020 31:0 ffff fff0 ATTR_8

    Register ( slcr )PL_LINK_CTRL_STATUS

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    PL_LINK_CTRL_STATUS 0XFD480228 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_PL_LINK_CTRL_STATUS_DIR_LINK_WIDTH 17:16 30000 2 20000 Specifies the target link width for a directed link change operation, 00b - X1, 01b - X2, 10b - X4 and 11b -X8
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_PL_LINK_CTRL_STATUS_DIR_LINK_SPEED 18:18 40000 1 40000 Specifies the target link speed for a directed link change operation 0b - 2.5Gb/s 1b - 5.0GB/s
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_PL_LINK_CTRL_STATUS@0XFD480228 31:0 70000 60000 PL_LINK_CTRL_STATUS

    Register ( slcr )ATTR_27

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    ATTR_27 0XFD48006C 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_ATTR_27_ATTR_DEV_CAP_MAX_PAYLOAD_SUPPORTED 10:8 700 1 100 Specifies maximum payload supported. Valid settings are: 0- 128 bytes, 1- 256 bytes, 2- 512 bytes, 3- 1024 bytes. Transferred to the Device Capabilities register. The values: 4-2048 bytes, 5- 4096 bytes are not supported; EP=0x0001; RP=0x0001
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_ATTR_27_ATTR_DEV_CAP_ENDPOINT_L1_LATENCY 5:3 38 7 38 Endpoint L1 Acceptable Latency. Records the latency that the endpoint can withstand on transitions from L1 state to L0 (if L1 state supported). Valid settings are: 0h less than 1us, 1h 1 to 2us, 2h 2 to 4us, 3h 4 to 8us, 4h 8 to 16us, 5h 16 to 32us, 6h 32 to 64us, 7h more than 64us. For Endpoints only. Must be 0h for other devices.; EP=0x0007; RP=0x0000
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_ATTR_27@0XFD48006C 31:0 738 138 ATTR_27

    Register ( slcr )ATTR_50

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    ATTR_50 0XFD4800C8 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_ATTR_50_ATTR_PCIE_CAP_DEVICE_PORT_TYPE 7:4 f0 0 0 Identifies the type of device/port as follows: 0000b PCI Express Endpoint device, 0001b Legacy PCI Express Endpoint device, 0100b Root Port of PCI Express Root Complex, 0101b Upstream Port of PCI Express Switch, 0110b Downstream Port of PCI Express Switch, 0111b PCIE Express to PCI/PCI-X Bridge, 1000b PCI/PCI-X to PCI Express Bridge. Transferred to PCI Express Capabilities register. Must be consistent with IS_SWITCH and UPSTREAM_FACING settings.; EP=0x0000; RP=0x0004
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_ATTR_50_ATTR_PCIE_CAP_NEXTPTR 15:8 ff00 0 0 PCIe Capability's Next Capability Offset pointer to the next item in the capabilities list, or 00h if this is the final capability.; EP=0x009C; RP=0x0000

    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_ATTR_105@0XFD4801A4 31:0 7ff 172 ATTR_105

    Register ( slcr )ATTR_106

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    ATTR_106 0XFD4801A8 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_ATTR_106_ATTR_VC0_TOTAL_CREDITS_CH 6:0 7f 48 48 Number of credits that should be advertised for Completion headers received on Virtual Channel 0. The sum of the posted, non posted, and completion header credits must be <= 80; EP=0x0048; RP=0x0024
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_ATTR_106_ATTR_VC0_TOTAL_CREDITS_NPH 13:7 3f80 4 200 Number of credits that should be advertised for Non-Posted headers received on Virtual Channel 0. The number of non posted data credits advertised by the block is equal to the number of non posted header credits. The sum of the posted, non posted, and completion header credits must be <= 80; EP=0x0004; RP=0x000C
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_ATTR_106@0XFD4801A8 31:0 3fff 248 ATTR_106

    Register ( slcr )ATTR_107

    Register Name Address Width Type Reset Value Description
    ATTR_107 0XFD4801AC 32 rw 0x00000000 --

    Field Name Bits Mask Value Shifted Value Description
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_ATTR_107_ATTR_VC0_TOTAL_CREDITS_NPD 10:0 7ff 8 8 Number of credits that should be advertised for Non-Posted data received on Virtual Channel 0. The number of non posted data credits advertised by the block is equal to two times the number of non posted header credits if atomic operations are supported or is equal to the number of non posted header credits if atomic operations are not supported. The bytes advertised must be less than or equal to the bram bytes available. See VC0_RX_RAM_LIMIT; EP=0x0008; RP=0x0018
    PSU_PCIE_ATTRIB_ATTR_107@0XFD4801AC 31:0 7ff 8 ATTR_107
